results.definition: hasty and without attention to detail; not thorough
examples: a casual (or cursory) inspection failed to reveal the house's structural flaws

results.definition: characterized by a feeling of irresponsibility
examples: a broken back is nothing to be casual about; it is no fooling matter

results.definition: occurring on a temporary or irregular basis
examples: a casual correspondence with a former teacher

results.definition: occurring or appearing or singled out by chance

examples: an ability to interest casual students
showed a casual disregard for cold weather
using their Christian names in a casual way
a difficult feat performed with casual mastery

results.definition: appropriate for ordinary or routine occasions
without or seeming to be without plan or method; offhand
examples: information collected by casual methods and in their spare time
